functions.name: add_club_member
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.add_club_member(p_club_id uuid, p_user_id uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
BEGIN
    INSERT INTO club_members (club_id, user_id)
    VALUES (p_club_id, p_user_id)
    ON CONFLICT (club_id, user_id) 
    DO UPDATE SET 
        updated_at = now();
END;
$function$

functions.name: check_account_entry_type
check_auth_tables
check_availability_conflicts
check_pilot_availability
functions.arguments: p_pilot_id uuid, p_date date, p_start_time time without time zone, p_end_time time without time zone
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.check_pilot_availability(p_pilot_id uuid, p_date date, p_start_time time without time zone, p_end_time time without time zone)
 RETURNS boolean
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
  RETURN EXISTS (
    SELECT 1 FROM pilot_availabilities
    WHERE pilot_id = p_pilot_id
    AND day_of_week = EXTRACT(DOW FROM p_date)
    AND start_time <= p_start_time
    AND end_time >= p_end_time
    AND (
      is_recurring = false
      OR (
        is_recurring = true
        AND start_date <= p_date
        AND end_date >= p_date
      )
    )
  );
END;
$function$

functions.name: check_user_role
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.check_user_role(user_id uuid, required_roles text[])
 RETURNS boolean
 LANGUAGE sql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
  SELECT EXISTS (
    SELECT 1 
    FROM auth.users au
    WHERE au.id = user_id 
    AND (au.raw_user_meta_data->>'role')::text = ANY(required_roles)
  );
$function$

functions.name: cleanup_orphaned_auth_users
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.cleanup_orphaned_auth_users()
 RETURNS TABLE(deleted_id uuid, email character varying)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
begin
  return query
  with orphaned_users as (
    select au.id, au.email
    from auth.users au
    left join public.users pu on pu.id = au.id
    where pu.id is null
    and au.id != '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000' -- Exclure l'utilisateur systme
  ),
  deleted_users as (
    delete from auth.users au
    using orphaned_users ou
    where au.id = ou.id
    returning au.id, au.email
  )
  select * from deleted_users;
end;
$function$

functions.name: create_auth_user
functions.arguments: p_email text, p_login text, p_password text, p_role text, p_user_id uuid, p_user_metadata jsonb DEFAULT '{}'::jsonb
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.create_auth_user(p_email text, p_login text, p_password text, p_role text, p_user_id uuid, p_user_metadata jsonb DEFAULT '{}'::jsonb)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
declare
    v_uid uuid;
begin
    -- Create the user in auth.users
    insert into auth.users (
        instance_id,
        id,
        aud,
        role,
        email,
        encrypted_password,
        email_confirmed_at,
        recovery_sent_at,
        last_sign_in_at,
        raw_app_meta_data,
        raw_user_meta_data,
        created_at,
        updated_at,
        confirmation_token,
        email_change,
        email_change_token_new,
        recovery_token
    )
    values (
        '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000',
        p_user_id,
        'authenticated',
        'authenticated',
        p_email,
        crypt(p_password, gen_salt('bf')),
        now(),
        null,
        now(),
        jsonb_build_object(
            'provider', 'email',
            'providers', array['email']::text[],
            'role', 'authenticated'
        ),
        p_user_metadata,
        now(),
        now(),
        '',
        '',
        '',
        ''
    )
    returning id into v_uid;

    -- Insert into auth.identities
    insert into auth.identities (
        id,
        user_id,
        identity_data,
        provider,
        provider_id,
        last_sign_in_at,
        created_at,
        updated_at
    )
    values (
        gen_random_uuid(),
        v_uid,
        jsonb_build_object(
            'sub', v_uid,
            'email', p_email,
            'login', p_login,
            'role', 'authenticated'
        ),
        'email',
        p_email,
        now(),
        now(),
        now()
    );

    -- Update auth_id in public.users
    update public.users
    set auth_id = v_uid
    where id = p_user_id;
end;
$function$

functions.name: create_club_filter_policy
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.create_club_filter_policy(table_name text)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
  EXECUTE format('
    CREATE POLICY "%I_club_policy" ON %I
      USING (
        club_id IN (
          SELECT club_id 
          FROM club_members 
          WHERE user_id = auth.uid()
        )
      )', table_name, table_name);
END;
$function$

functions.name: create_flight_with_account
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.create_flight_with_account(flight_data jsonb, account_data jsonb)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE
  flight_id uuid;
BEGIN
  -- Log les donnes reues
  RAISE NOTICE 'Flight data: %', flight_data;
  RAISE NOTICE 'Account data: %', account_data;

  -- Insrer le vol et rcuprer son ID
  INSERT INTO flights (
    id,
    reservation_id,
    user_id,
    aircraft_id,
    flight_type_id,
    instructor_id,
    date,
    duration,
    destination,
    hourly_rate,
    cost,
    payment_method,
    is_validated,
    created_at,
    updated_at
  )
  SELECT 
    (flight_data->>'id')::uuid,
    NULLIF(flight_data->>'reservation_id', '')::uuid,
    (flight_data->>'user_id')::uuid,
    (flight_data->>'aircraft_id')::uuid,
    flight_data->>'flight_type_id',
    NULLIF(flight_data->>'instructor_id', '')::uuid,
    (flight_data->>'date')::timestamp with time zone,
    (flight_data->>'duration')::integer,
    NULLIF(flight_data->>'destination', ''),
    (flight_data->>'hourly_rate')::decimal,
    (flight_data->>'cost')::decimal,
    flight_data->>'payment_method',
    (flight_data->>'is_validated')::boolean,
    (flight_data->>'created_at')::timestamp with time zone,
    (flight_data->>'updated_at')::timestamp with time zone
  RETURNING id INTO flight_id;
  
  -- Log l'ID du vol cr
  RAISE NOTICE 'Created flight with ID: %', flight_id;
  
  -- Insrer l'entre comptable avec la description fournie
  INSERT INTO account_entries (
    id,
    user_id,
    date,
    type,
    amount,
    payment_method,
    description,
    is_validated,
    created_at,
    updated_at
  )
  SELECT 
    (account_data->>'id')::uuid,
    (account_data->>'user_id')::uuid,
    (account_data->>'date')::timestamp with time zone,
    account_data->>'type',
    (account_data->>'amount')::decimal,
    account_data->>'payment_method',
    account_data->>'description',
    (account_data->>'is_validated')::boolean,
    (account_data->>'created_at')::timestamp with time zone,
    (account_data->>'updated_at')::timestamp with time zone;

  -- Log le succs
  RAISE NOTICE 'Successfully created flight and account entry';
END;
$function$

functions.name: create_flight_with_account_and_update
functions.arguments: flight_data jsonb, account_data jsonb, new_total_hours numeric, new_hours_before_maintenance numeric
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.create_flight_with_account_and_update(flight_data jsonb, account_data jsonb, new_total_hours numeric, new_hours_before_maintenance numeric)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE
  flight_id uuid;
BEGIN
  -- Insrer le vol
  INSERT INTO flights (
    id,
    reservation_id,
    user_id,
    aircraft_id,
    flight_type_id,
    instructor_id,
    date,
    duration,
    destination,
    hourly_rate,
    cost,
    payment_method,
    is_validated,
    created_at,
    updated_at
  )
  SELECT 
    (flight_data->>'id')::uuid,
    NULLIF(flight_data->>'reservation_id', '')::uuid,
    (flight_data->>'user_id')::uuid,
    (flight_data->>'aircraft_id')::uuid,
    flight_data->>'flight_type_id',
    NULLIF(flight_data->>'instructor_id', '')::uuid,
    (flight_data->>'date')::timestamp with time zone,
    (flight_data->>'duration')::integer,
    NULLIF(flight_data->>'destination', ''),
    (flight_data->>'hourly_rate')::decimal,
    (flight_data->>'cost')::decimal,
    flight_data->>'payment_method',
    (flight_data->>'is_validated')::boolean,
    (flight_data->>'created_at')::timestamp with time zone,
    (flight_data->>'updated_at')::timestamp with time zone;

  -- Mettre  jour les heures de l'appareil
  UPDATE aircraft 
  SET 
    total_flight_hours = new_total_hours,
    hours_before_maintenance = new_hours_before_maintenance
  WHERE id = (flight_data->>'aircraft_id')::uuid;
  
  -- Insrer l'entre comptable
  INSERT INTO account_entries (
    id,
    user_id,
    date,
    type,
    amount,
    payment_method,
    description,
    is_validated,
    created_at,
    updated_at
  )
  SELECT 
    (account_data->>'id')::uuid,
    (account_data->>'user_id')::uuid,
    (account_data->>'date')::timestamp with time zone,
    account_data->>'type',
    (account_data->>'amount')::decimal,
    account_data->>'payment_method',
    account_data->>'description',
    (account_data->>'is_validated')::boolean,
    (account_data->>'created_at')::timestamp with time zone,
    (account_data->>'updated_at')::timestamp with time zone;
END;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.delete_chat_room(room_id uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
BEGIN
  -- Delete all messages in the room
  DELETE FROM chat_messages WHERE chat_messages.room_id = $1;
  
  -- Delete all room members
  DELETE FROM chat_room_members WHERE chat_room_members.room_id = $1;
  
  -- Delete the room itself
  DELETE FROM chat_rooms WHERE chat_rooms.id = $1;
END;
$function$

functions.arguments: instructor_id uuid, start_date date, end_date date
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.generate_instructor_invoice(instructor_id uuid, start_date date, end_date date)
 RETURNS uuid
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE
    v_invoice_id uuid;
BEGIN
    -- Crer la facture
    INSERT INTO instructor_invoices (
        instructor_id,
        start_date,
        end_date,
        status,
        created_at,
        updated_at
    )
    VALUES (
        instructor_id,
        start_date,
        end_date,
        'DRAFT',
        NOW(),
        NOW()
    )
    RETURNING id INTO v_invoice_id;

    -- Insrer les dtails de la facture
    -- Ne prendre que les vols qui n'ont pas de facture ou dont la facture n'est pas valide
    INSERT INTO instructor_invoice_details (
        invoice_id,
        flight_id,
        amount,
        created_at,
        updated_at
    )
    SELECT 
        v_invoice_id,
        f.id,
        f.cost * 0.5, -- 50% du cot du vol pour l'instructeur
        NOW(),
        NOW()
    FROM flights f
    LEFT JOIN instructor_invoice_details iid ON f.id = iid.flight_id
    LEFT JOIN instructor_invoices ii ON iid.invoice_id = ii.id
    WHERE 
        f.instructor_id = instructor_id
        AND f.date BETWEEN start_date AND end_date
        AND (
            iid.id IS NULL -- Vol pas encore factur
            OR (
                ii.status != 'VALIDATED' -- Ou facture existante non valide
                AND ii.id != v_invoice_id -- viter de dupliquer les vols de la facture en cours
            )
        );

    RETURN v_invoice_id;
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_financial_stats
functions.arguments: start_date timestamp with time zone, end_date timestamp with time zone
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_financial_stats(start_date timestamp with time zone, end_date timestamp with time zone)
 RETURNS json
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
DECLARE
    result json;
    current_club_id uuid;
BEGIN
    -- Tentez d'obtenir le club_id de l'utilisateur connect
    SELECT club_id INTO current_club_id
    FROM club_members
    WHERE user_id = auth.uid()
    LIMIT 1;

    -- Si un club_id est trouv, appliquez le filtre, sinon retournez toutes les donnes
    WITH RECURSIVE months AS (
        SELECT date_trunc('month', start_date) as month
        UNION ALL
        SELECT date_trunc('month', month + interval '1 month')
        FROM months
        WHERE month < date_trunc('month', end_date)
    ),
    monthly_stats AS (
        SELECT
            m.month,
            COALESCE(SUM(CASE 
                WHEN aet.is_credit THEN ae.amount 
                ELSE 0 
            END), 0) AS revenue,
            COALESCE(SUM(CASE 
                WHEN NOT aet.is_credit THEN ae.amount
                ELSE 0 
            END), 0) AS expenses
        FROM months m
        LEFT JOIN account_entries ae ON date_trunc('month', ae.date) = m.month
            AND ae.is_validated = true
            AND (current_club_id IS NULL OR ae.club_id = current_club_id)
        LEFT JOIN account_entry_types aet ON ae.entry_type_id = aet.id
        GROUP BY m.month
    )
    SELECT json_build_object(
        'monthly_stats', (
            SELECT json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'month', month,
                    'revenue', revenue,
                    'expenses', expenses
                )
            ) FROM monthly_stats
        )
    ) INTO result;

    RETURN result;
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_financial_stats
functions.arguments: p_club_id uuid, start_date timestamp with time zone, end_date timestamp with time zone
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_financial_stats(p_club_id uuid, start_date timestamp with time zone, end_date timestamp with time zone)
 RETURNS json
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
DECLARE
    result json;
BEGIN
    WITH RECURSIVE months AS (
        SELECT date_trunc('month', start_date) as month
        UNION ALL
        SELECT date_trunc('month', month + interval '1 month')
        FROM months
        WHERE month < date_trunc('month', end_date)
    ),
    monthly_stats AS (
        SELECT
            m.month,
            COALESCE(SUM(CASE 
                WHEN aet.is_credit THEN ae.amount 
                ELSE 0 
            END), 0) AS revenue,
            COALESCE(SUM(CASE 
                WHEN NOT aet.is_credit THEN ae.amount
                ELSE 0 
            END), 0) AS expenses
        FROM months m
        LEFT JOIN account_entries ae ON date_trunc('month', ae.date) = m.month
            AND ae.is_validated = true
            AND ae.club_id = p_club_id
        LEFT JOIN account_entry_types aet ON ae.entry_type_id = aet.id
        GROUP BY m.month
    ),
    payment_methods AS (
        SELECT
            ae.payment_method,
            COUNT(*) as count,
            SUM(CASE 
                WHEN aet.is_credit THEN ae.amount
                ELSE -ae.amount
            END) as total
        FROM account_entries ae
        LEFT JOIN account_entry_types aet ON ae.entry_type_id = aet.id
        WHERE ae.date BETWEEN start_date AND end_date
        AND ae.is_validated = true
        AND ae.club_id = p_club_id
        GROUP BY ae.payment_method
    ),
    entry_types AS (
        SELECT
            aet.code,
            aet.name,
            aet.is_credit,
            COUNT(*) as count,
            SUM(ae.amount) as total,
            MIN(ae.amount) as min_amount,
            MAX(ae.amount) as max_amount
        FROM account_entries ae
        LEFT JOIN account_entry_types aet ON ae.entry_type_id = aet.id
        WHERE ae.date BETWEEN start_date AND end_date
        AND ae.is_validated = true
        AND ae.club_id = p_club_id
        GROUP BY aet.code, aet.name, aet.is_credit
    )
    SELECT json_build_object(
        'total_revenue', COALESCE((
            SELECT SUM(revenue)
            FROM monthly_stats
        ), 0),
        'total_expenses', COALESCE((
            SELECT SUM(expenses)
            FROM monthly_stats
        ), 0),
        'monthly_stats', COALESCE((
            SELECT json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'month', trim(to_char(month, 'Month YYYY')),
                    'revenue', revenue,
                    'expenses', expenses,
                    'total', revenue + expenses
                )
                ORDER BY month DESC
            )
            FROM monthly_stats
        ), '[]'::json),
        'payment_methods', COALESCE((
            SELECT json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'method', payment_method,
                    'count', count,
                    'total', total
                )
                ORDER BY payment_method
            )
            FROM payment_methods
        ), '[]'::json),
        'entry_types', COALESCE((
            SELECT json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'code', code,
                    'name', name,
                    'is_credit', is_credit,
                    'count', count,
                    'total', total,
                    'min_amount', min_amount,
                    'max_amount', max_amount
                )
                ORDER BY is_credit DESC, total DESC
            )
            FROM entry_types
        ), '[]'::json)
    ) INTO result;

    RETURN result;
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_financial_stats_last_12_months
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_financial_stats_last_12_months()
 RETURNS json
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$DECLARE
    result json;
BEGIN
    WITH revenue_by_type AS (
        SELECT 
            aet.code as type,
            aet.name as type_name,
            SUM(ae.amount) as total
        FROM account_entries ae
        JOIN account_entry_types aet ON ae.entry_type_id = aet.id
        WHERE ae.created_at >= NOW() - INTERVAL '12 months'
        AND aet.is_credit = true
        -- Ajout du filtre par club
        AND ae.club_id IN (
            SELECT club_members.club_id
            FROM club_members
            WHERE club_members.user_id = auth.uid()
        )
        GROUP BY aet.code, aet.name
    ),
    monthly_revenue AS (
        SELECT 
            date_trunc('month', ae.created_at) as month,
            aet.code as type,
            SUM(ae.amount) as total
        FROM account_entries ae
        JOIN account_entry_types aet ON ae.entry_type_id = aet.id
        WHERE ae.created_at >= NOW() - INTERVAL '12 months'
        AND aet.is_credit = true
        -- Ajout du filtre par club
        AND ae.club_id IN (
            SELECT club_members.club_id
            FROM club_members
            WHERE club_members.user_id = auth.uid()
        )
        GROUP BY date_trunc('month', ae.created_at), aet.code
        ORDER BY month DESC
    )
    SELECT json_build_object(
        'total_revenue', (
            SELECT SUM(total)
            FROM revenue_by_type
        ),
        'revenue_by_type', (
            SELECT json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'type', type,
                    'name', type_name,
                    'total', total
                )
            )
            FROM revenue_by_type
        ),
        'monthly_revenue', (
            SELECT json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'month', to_char(month, 'YYYY-MM'),
                    'type', type,
                    'total', total
                )
            )
            FROM monthly_revenue
        )
    ) INTO result;

    RETURN result;
END;$function$

functions.name: get_flights_by_aircraft
functions.arguments: start_date timestamp without time zone, end_date timestamp without time zone
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_flights_by_aircraft(start_date timestamp without time zone, end_date timestamp without time zone)
 RETURNS TABLE(registration text, total_hours double precision)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
  RETURN QUERY
  SELECT 
    a.registration,
    CAST(SUM(f.duration) AS double precision) / 60.0 as total_hours
  FROM flights f
  JOIN aircraft a ON f.aircraft_id = a.id
  WHERE f.date BETWEEN start_date AND end_date
  GROUP BY a.registration
  ORDER BY total_hours DESC;
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_flights_by_instructor
functions.arguments: start_date timestamp without time zone, end_date timestamp without time zone
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_flights_by_instructor(start_date timestamp without time zone, end_date timestamp without time zone)
 RETURNS TABLE(instructor_name text, total_hours double precision)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
  RETURN QUERY
  SELECT 
    CONCAT(u.first_name, ' ', u.last_name) as instructor_name,
    CAST(SUM(f.duration) AS double precision) / 60.0 as total_hours
  FROM flights f
  JOIN users u ON f.instructor_id = u.id
  WHERE f.date BETWEEN start_date AND end_date
  GROUP BY u.id, u.first_name, u.last_name
  ORDER BY total_hours DESC;
END;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_flights_by_type(start_date timestamp without time zone, end_date timestamp without time zone)
 RETURNS TABLE(type_name text, total_hours double precision)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
  RETURN QUERY
  SELECT 
    ft.name as type_name,
    CAST(SUM(f.duration) AS double precision) / 60.0 as total_hours
  FROM flights f
  JOIN flight_types ft ON f.flight_type_id = ft.id
  WHERE f.date BETWEEN start_date AND end_date
  GROUP BY ft.id, ft.name
  ORDER BY total_hours DESC;
END;

functions.name: get_flights_with_instructor
functions.arguments: start_date timestamp with time zone, end_date timestamp with time zone
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_flights_with_instructor(start_date timestamp with time zone, end_date timestamp with time zone)
 RETURNS TABLE(month text, has_instructor text, flight_type text, flight_type_code text, display_order integer, total_hours numeric)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
begin
    return query
    select 
        to_char(date_trunc('month', f.date), 'YYYY-MM') as month,
        case when f.instructor_id is not null then 'Avec instructeur' else 'Sans instructeur' end as has_instructor,
        ft.name as flight_type,
        ft.code as flight_type_code,
        ft.display_order,
        round(sum(f.duration::numeric / 60), 1) as total_hours
    from flights f
    join flight_types ft on f.flight_type_id = ft.id
    where f.date >= start_date
    and f.date <= end_date
    and f.is_validated = true
    group by 
        date_trunc('month', f.date),
        case when f.instructor_id is not null then 'Avec instructeur' else 'Sans instructeur' end,
        ft.name,
        ft.code,
        ft.display_order
    order by month, display_order;
end;
$function$

functions.name: get_functions_info
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_functions_info()
 RETURNS jsonb
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
BEGIN
  RETURN (
    SELECT jsonb_agg(
      jsonb_build_object(
        'name', p.proname,
        'arguments', pg_get_function_arguments(p.oid),
        'return_type', t.typname,
        'definition', pg_get_functiondef(p.oid)
      )
    )
    FROM pg_proc p
    JOIN pg_type t ON p.prorettype = t.oid
    WHERE p.pronamespace = 'public'::regnamespace
  );
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_maintenance_stats
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_maintenance_stats()
 RETURNS json
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
DECLARE
    result json;
BEGIN
    WITH member_club AS (
        SELECT club_id
        FROM club_members
        WHERE user_id = auth.uid()
        LIMIT 1
    ),
    flight_stats AS (
        SELECT 
            a.id AS aircraft_id,
            COUNT(f.id) AS total_flights_30d,
            COALESCE(SUM(f.duration) / 60.0, 0) AS total_hours_30d,
            MAX(f.date) AS last_flight
        FROM aircraft a
        LEFT JOIN flights f ON a.id = f.aircraft_id
            AND f.date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days'
            AND f.is_validated = TRUE
        WHERE a.club_id = (SELECT club_id FROM member_club)
        GROUP BY a.id
    ),
    maintenance_alerts AS (
        SELECT
            a.id,
            a.registration,
            a.name,
            a.type AS model,
            a.total_flight_hours,
            a.hours_before_maintenance,
            a.last_maintenance,
            a.status,
            CASE 
                WHEN (a.hours_before_maintenance <= 0) THEN 'OVERDUE'
                WHEN (a.hours_before_maintenance <= 10) THEN 'URGENT'
                WHEN (a.hours_before_maintenance <= 25) THEN 'WARNING'
                ELSE 'OK'
            END AS maintenance_status
        FROM aircraft a
        WHERE a.club_id = (SELECT club_id FROM member_club)
    )
    SELECT json_build_object(
        'aircraft_stats', (
            SELECT json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'id', ma.id,
                    'registration', ma.registration,
                    'name', ma.name,
                    'model', ma.model,
                    'total_hours', ma.total_flight_hours,
                    'hours_before_maintenance', ma.hours_before_maintenance,
                    'last_maintenance', ma.last_maintenance,
                    'status', ma.status,
                    'maintenance_status', ma.maintenance_status,
                    'total_flights_30d', COALESCE(fs.total_flights_30d, 0),
                    'total_hours_30d', COALESCE(fs.total_hours_30d, 0),
                    'last_flight', fs.last_flight
                )
            )
            FROM maintenance_alerts ma
            LEFT JOIN flight_stats fs ON ma.id = fs.aircraft_id
        ),
        'alerts_count', (
            SELECT json_build_object(
                'overdue', COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE ma.maintenance_status = 'OVERDUE'),
                'urgent', COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE ma.maintenance_status = 'URGENT'),
                'warning', COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE ma.maintenance_status = 'WARNING'),
                'ok', COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE ma.maintenance_status = 'OK')
            )
            FROM maintenance_alerts ma
        )
    ) INTO result;

    RETURN result;
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_member_stats
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_member_stats()
 RETURNS json
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
DECLARE
    result json;
    current_club_id uuid;
BEGIN
    -- Tentez d'obtenir le club_id de l'utilisateur connect
    SELECT club_id INTO current_club_id
    FROM club_members
    WHERE user_id = auth.uid()
    LIMIT 1;

    -- Si un club_id est trouv, appliquez le filtre, sinon retournez toutes les donnes
    SELECT json_build_object(
        'active_members', (
            SELECT COUNT(*)
            FROM club_members cm
            JOIN member_contributions mc ON cm.user_id = mc.user_id
            WHERE mc.valid_until >= CURRENT_DATE
              AND (current_club_id IS NULL OR cm.club_id = current_club_id)
        ),
        'expiring_memberships', (
            SELECT json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'id', u.id,
                    'first_name', u.first_name,
                    'last_name', u.last_name,
                    'expiry_date', mc.valid_until
                )
            )
            FROM users u
            JOIN member_contributions mc ON u.id = mc.user_id
            JOIN club_members cm ON u.id = cm.user_id
            WHERE mc.valid_until BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days'
              AND (current_club_id IS NULL OR cm.club_id = current_club_id)
        ),
        'qualification_stats', (
            SELECT json_build_object(
                'expired', COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE pq.expires_at < CURRENT_DATE),
                'expiring_soon', COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE pq.expires_at BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days'),
                'expiring_details', json_agg(
                    json_build_object(
                        'pilot_id', u.id,
                        'first_name', u.first_name,
                        'last_name', u.last_name,
                        'qualification', qt.name,
                        'expiry_date', pq.expires_at
                    )
                ) FILTER (WHERE pq.expires_at BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days')
            )
            FROM pilot_qualifications pq
            JOIN users u ON pq.pilot_id = u.id
            JOIN qualification_types qt ON pq.qualification_type_id = qt.id
            JOIN club_members cm ON u.id = cm.user_id
            WHERE pq.expires_at IS NOT NULL
              AND (current_club_id IS NULL OR cm.club_id = current_club_id)
        ),
        'medical_stats', (
            SELECT json_build_object(
                'expired', COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE m.expires_at < CURRENT_DATE),
                'expiring_soon', COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE m.expires_at BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days'),
                'expiring_details', json_agg(
                    json_build_object(
                        'pilot_id', u.id,
                        'first_name', u.first_name,
                        'last_name', u.last_name,
                        'expiry_date', m.expires_at
                    )
                ) FILTER (WHERE m.expires_at BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days')
            )
            FROM medicals m
            JOIN users u ON m.user_id = u.id
            JOIN club_members cm ON u.id = cm.user_id
            WHERE m.expires_at IS NOT NULL
              AND (current_club_id IS NULL OR cm.club_id = current_club_id)
        )
    ) INTO result;

    RETURN result;
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_member_stats
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_member_stats(p_club_id uuid)
 RETURNS json
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
DECLARE
    result json;
BEGIN
    WITH active_members AS (
        SELECT DISTINCT mc.user_id
        FROM member_contributions mc
        JOIN club_members cm ON mc.user_id = cm.user_id
        WHERE mc.valid_until >= CURRENT_DATE
        AND cm.club_id = p_club_id
    ),
    expiring_soon AS (
        SELECT 
            u.id,
            u.first_name,
            u.last_name,
            mc.valid_until as expiry_date
        FROM users u
        JOIN member_contributions mc ON u.id = mc.user_id
        JOIN club_members cm ON u.id = cm.user_id
        WHERE mc.valid_until BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days'
        AND cm.club_id = p_club_id
        AND NOT EXISTS (
            SELECT 1 
            FROM member_contributions mc2
            WHERE mc2.user_id = u.id
            AND mc2.valid_until > mc.valid_until
        )
    ),
    qualification_stats AS (
        SELECT
            COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE pq.expires_at < CURRENT_DATE) as expired_qualifications,
            COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE pq.expires_at BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days') as expiring_qualifications,
            json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'pilot_id', u.id,
                    'first_name', u.first_name,
                    'last_name', u.last_name,
                    'qualification', qt.name,
                    'expiry_date', pq.expires_at
                )
            ) FILTER (WHERE pq.expires_at BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days') as expiring_details
        FROM pilot_qualifications pq
        JOIN users u ON pq.pilot_id = u.id
        JOIN club_members cm ON u.id = cm.user_id
        JOIN qualification_types qt ON pq.qualification_type_id = qt.id
        WHERE pq.expires_at IS NOT NULL
        AND cm.club_id = p_club_id
    ),
    medical_stats AS (
        SELECT
            COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE m.expires_at < CURRENT_DATE) as expired_medicals,
            COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE m.expires_at BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days') as expiring_medicals,
            json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'pilot_id', u.id,
                    'first_name', u.first_name,
                    'last_name', u.last_name,
                    'expiry_date', m.expires_at
                )
            ) FILTER (WHERE m.expires_at BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days') as expiring_details
        FROM medicals m
        JOIN users u ON m.user_id = u.id
        JOIN club_members cm ON u.id = cm.user_id
        WHERE m.expires_at IS NOT NULL
        AND cm.club_id = p_club_id
    )
    SELECT json_build_object(
        'active_members', (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM active_members),
        'expiring_soon', (
            SELECT json_agg(
                json_build_object(
                    'id', id,
                    'first_name', first_name,
                    'last_name', last_name,
                    'expiry_date', expiry_date
                )
            )
            FROM expiring_soon
        ),
        'qualification_stats', (
            SELECT json_build_object(
                'expired', expired_qualifications,
                'expiring', expiring_qualifications,
                'expiring_details', COALESCE(expiring_details, '[]'::json)
            )
            FROM qualification_stats
        ),
        'medical_stats', (
            SELECT json_build_object(
                'expired', expired_medicals,
                'expiring', expiring_medicals,
                'expiring_details', COALESCE(expiring_details, '[]'::json)
            )
            FROM medical_stats
        )
    ) INTO result;

    RETURN result;
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_monthly_account_summary
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_monthly_account_summary(p_year integer DEFAULT (EXTRACT(year FROM CURRENT_DATE))::integer)
 RETURNS TABLE(month_name text, entry_type_code text, entry_type_name text, total_amount numeric)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
  RETURN QUERY
  WITH months AS (
    SELECT TO_CHAR(DATE_TRUNC('month', (p_year || '-' || m || '-01')::date), 'Month') as month_name,
           m as month_number
    FROM generate_series(1,12) m
  )
  SELECT 
    m.month_name,
    aet.code as entry_type_code,
    aet.name as entry_type_name,
    COALESCE(ABS(SUM(ae.amount)), 0) as total_amount
  FROM months m
  CROSS JOIN account_entry_types aet
  LEFT JOIN account_entries ae ON 
    EXTRACT(MONTH FROM ae.date) = m.month_number AND
    EXTRACT(YEAR FROM ae.date) = p_year AND
    ae.entry_type_id = aet.id
  GROUP BY m.month_name, m.month_number, aet.code, aet.name
  ORDER BY m.month_number, aet.code;
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_monthly_aircraft_hours
functions.arguments: start_date timestamp with time zone, end_date timestamp with time zone
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_monthly_aircraft_hours(start_date timestamp with time zone, end_date timestamp with time zone)
 RETURNS TABLE(aircraft_id uuid, aircraft_registration text, month date, total_hours numeric)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
DECLARE
    current_club_id UUID;
BEGIN
    -- Rcuprer le club ID du membre connect
    SELECT club_id INTO current_club_id
    FROM club_members
    WHERE user_id = auth.uid()
    LIMIT 1;

    -- Vrifier si l'utilisateur est associ  un club
    IF current_club_id IS NULL THEN
        RAISE EXCEPTION 'Utilisateur non associ  un club';
    END IF;

    -- Rcuprer les donnes des avions du mme club
    RETURN QUERY
    SELECT 
        a.id AS aircraft_id,
        a.registration AS aircraft_registration,
        DATE_TRUNC('month', f.date)::date AS month,
        ROUND(SUM(f.duration)::numeric / 60, 2) AS total_hours
    FROM aircraft a
    LEFT JOIN flights f ON f.aircraft_id = a.id
    WHERE 
        a.club_id = current_club_id
        AND f.date >= start_date
        AND f.date <= end_date
        AND f.is_validated = TRUE
    GROUP BY a.id, a.registration, DATE_TRUNC('month', f.date)
    ORDER BY a.registration, month;
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_monthly_aircraft_hours
functions.arguments: p_club_id uuid, start_date timestamp with time zone, end_date timestamp with time zone
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_monthly_aircraft_hours(p_club_id uuid, start_date timestamp with time zone, end_date timestamp with time zone)
 RETURNS TABLE(aircraft_id uuid, aircraft_registration text, month timestamp with time zone, total_hours numeric)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
BEGIN
    RETURN QUERY
    WITH monthly_hours AS (
        SELECT 
            a.id as aircraft_id,
            a.registration as aircraft_registration,
            date_trunc('month', f.date) as flight_month,
            COALESCE(SUM(f.duration)::numeric / 3600.0, 0) as hours
        FROM aircraft a
        LEFT JOIN flights f ON a.id = f.aircraft_id 
            AND f.date BETWEEN start_date AND end_date
            AND f.is_validated = true
        WHERE a.club_id = p_club_id
        GROUP BY a.id, a.registration, date_trunc('month', f.date)
    ),
    all_months AS (
        SELECT generate_series(
            date_trunc('month', start_date),
            date_trunc('month', end_date),
            '1 month'::interval
        ) as month_date
    ),
    aircraft_list AS (
        SELECT DISTINCT id, registration
        FROM aircraft
        WHERE club_id = p_club_id
    )
    SELECT 
        al.id as aircraft_id,
        al.registration as aircraft_registration,
        am.month_date as month,
        COALESCE(mh.hours, 0) as total_hours
    FROM all_months am
    CROSS JOIN aircraft_list al
    LEFT JOIN monthly_hours mh ON mh.aircraft_id = al.id 
        AND mh.flight_month = am.month_date
    ORDER BY al.registration, am.month_date;
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_monthly_flight_hours
functions.arguments: start_date timestamp without time zone, end_date timestamp without time zone
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_monthly_flight_hours(start_date timestamp without time zone, end_date timestamp without time zone)
 RETURNS TABLE(month text, year integer, total_hours double precision)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
  RETURN QUERY
  SELECT 
    TO_CHAR(f.date, 'Month') as month,
    EXTRACT(YEAR FROM f.date)::integer as year,
    CAST(SUM(f.duration) AS double precision) / 60.0 as total_hours
  FROM flights f
  WHERE f.date BETWEEN start_date AND end_date
  GROUP BY month, year, date_trunc('month', f.date)
  ORDER BY date_trunc('month', f.date);
END;
$function$

functions.name: get_recent_private_conversations
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_recent_private_conversations(current_user_id uuid)
 RETURNS TABLE(sender_id uuid, recipient_id uuid, content text, created_at timestamp with time zone, unread_count bigint)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
begin
  return query
    with latest_messages as (
      select distinct on (
        case 
          when pm.sender_id = current_user_id then pm.recipient_id 
          else pm.sender_id 
        end
      )
        pm.sender_id,
        pm.recipient_id,
        pm.content,
        pm.created_at
      from private_messages pm
      where pm.sender_id = current_user_id or pm.recipient_id = current_user_id
      order by 
        case 
          when pm.sender_id = current_user_id then pm.recipient_id 
          else pm.sender_id 
        end,
        pm.created_at desc
    ),
    unread_counts as (
      select 
        case 
          when pm.sender_id = current_user_id then pm.recipient_id 
          else pm.sender_id 
        end as contact_id,
        count(*) as unread_count
      from private_messages pm
      where 
        pm.recipient_id = current_user_id 
        and pm.read_at is null
      group by 
        case 
          when pm.sender_id = current_user_id then pm.recipient_id 
          else pm.sender_id 
        end
    )
    select 
      lm.sender_id,
      lm.recipient_id,
      lm.content,
      lm.created_at,
      coalesce(uc.unread_count, 0) as unread_count
    from latest_messages lm
    left join unread_counts uc on 
      case 
        when lm.sender_id = current_user_id then lm.recipient_id 
        else lm.sender_id 
      end = uc.contact_id
    order by lm.created_at desc;
end;
$function$

functions.name: get_schema_info
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_schema_info()
 RETURNS jsonb
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
BEGIN
  RETURN (
    SELECT jsonb_agg(
      jsonb_build_object(
        'name', tables.table_name,
        'columns', (
          SELECT jsonb_agg(
            jsonb_build_object(
              'name', columns.column_name,
              'type', columns.data_type,
              'nullable', columns.is_nullable = 'YES',
              'default_value', columns.column_default
            )
          )
          FROM information_schema.columns
          WHERE columns.table_name = tables.table_name
        ),
        'constraints', (
          SELECT jsonb_agg(constraint_name)
          FROM information_schema.table_constraints
          WHERE table_name = tables.table_name
        )
      )
    )
    FROM information_schema.tables
    WHERE table_schema = 'public'
  );
END;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.handle_category_deletion()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE
  uncategorized_id uuid;
BEGIN
  -- Get the uncategorized category id for this club
  SELECT id INTO uncategorized_id
  FROM document_categories
  WHERE club_id = OLD.club_id
  AND name = 'Non class'
  LIMIT 1;

  -- Move documents to uncategorized category
  UPDATE documents
  SET category_id = uncategorized_id
  WHERE category_id = OLD.id;
  
  RETURN OLD;
END;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.handle_new_user()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
BEGIN
  -- Vrifier si l'utilisateur existe dj dans public.users
  IF NOT EXISTS (
    SELECT 1 FROM public.users 
    WHERE email = NEW.email
  ) THEN
    INSERT INTO public.users (
      auth_id, 
      email, 
      first_name, 
      last_name, 
      role,
      login,  -- Ajout du login obligatoire
      password  -- Ajout du password obligatoire
    )
    VALUES (
      NEW.id, 
      NEW.email, 
      '', 
      '', 
      COALESCE((NEW.raw_user_meta_data->>'role')::text, 'PILOT'),
      split_part(NEW.email, '@', 1),  -- Utilise la partie avant @ de l'email comme login
      'TemporaryPassword123!'  -- Mot de passe temporaire
    );
  END IF;
  RETURN NEW;
END;
$function$

functions.name: insert_discovery_flight_permissions
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.insert_discovery_flight_permissions()
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE
    club_record RECORD;
BEGIN
    -- Pour chaque club
    FOR club_record IN SELECT id FROM clubs LOOP
        -- Visualisation des vols dcouverte
        INSERT INTO permission_settings (club_id, permission_id, allowed_roles, is_custom)
        VALUES (
            club_record.id,
            'discovery:view',
            ARRAY['ADMIN', 'DISCOVERY_PILOT']::text[],
            false
        )
        ON CONFLICT (club_id, permission_id) 
        DO UPDATE SET allowed_roles = ARRAY['ADMIN', 'DISCOVERY_PILOT']::text[];

        -- Cration des vols dcouverte
        INSERT INTO permission_settings (club_id, permission_id, allowed_roles, is_custom)
        VALUES (
            club_record.id,
            'discovery:create',
            ARRAY['ADMIN', 'DISCOVERY_PILOT']::text[],
            false
        )
        ON CONFLICT (club_id, permission_id) 
        DO UPDATE SET allowed_roles = ARRAY['ADMIN', 'DISCOVERY_PILOT']::text[];

        -- Modification des vols dcouverte
        INSERT INTO permission_settings (club_id, permission_id, allowed_roles, is_custom)
        VALUES (
            club_record.id,
            'discovery:modify',
            ARRAY['ADMIN', 'DISCOVERY_PILOT']::text[],
            false
        )
        ON CONFLICT (club_id, permission_id) 
        DO UPDATE SET allowed_roles = ARRAY['ADMIN', 'DISCOVERY_PILOT']::text[];

        -- Suppression des vols dcouverte
        INSERT INTO permission_settings (club_id, permission_id, allowed_roles, is_custom)
        VALUES (
            club_record.id,
            'discovery:delete',
            ARRAY['ADMIN']::text[],
            false
        )
        ON CONFLICT (club_id, permission_id) 
        DO UPDATE SET allowed_roles = ARRAY['ADMIN']::text[];
    END LOOP;
END;
$function$

functions.name: insert_maintenance
functions.arguments: aircraft_id uuid, maintenance_date timestamp with time zone, maintenance_type text, comments text, next_date timestamp with time zone, next_hours integer, hours_at_maintenance numeric
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.insert_maintenance(aircraft_id uuid, maintenance_date timestamp with time zone, maintenance_type text, comments text, next_date timestamp with time zone, next_hours integer, hours_at_maintenance numeric)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
    -- Insertion de la maintenance
    INSERT INTO maintenance (
        aircraft_id,
        date,
        type,
        comments,
        next_maintenance_date,
        next_maintenance_hours,
        aircraft_hours_at_maintenance
    ) VALUES (
        aircraft_id,
        maintenance_date,
        maintenance_type::maintenance_type,
        comments,
        next_date,
        next_hours,
        hours_at_maintenance
    );

    -- Mise  jour de l'appareil avec les nouvelles informations de maintenance
    UPDATE aircraft
    SET 
        last_maintenance = maintenance_date,
        next_maintenance_date = next_date,
        hours_before_maintenance = next_hours,
        updated_at = NOW()
    WHERE id = aircraft_id;
END;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.recreate_auth_constraint()
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
begin
  -- Recrer la contrainte de public.users vers auth.users
  alter table public.users 
  add constraint users_auth_id_fkey 
  foreign key (auth_id) 
  references auth.users(id);
  
  -- Recrer la contrainte de auth.identities vers auth.users
  alter table auth.identities
  add constraint identities_user_id_fkey
  foreign key (user_id)
  references auth.users(id);
  
  -- Recrer autres contraintes
  alter table auth.sessions
  add constraint sessions_user_id_fkey
  foreign key (user_id)
  references auth.users(id);
  
  alter table auth.mfa_factors
  add constraint mfa_factors_user_id_fkey
  foreign key (user_id)
  references auth.users(id);
  
  alter table auth.refresh_tokens
  add constraint refresh_tokens_user_id_fkey
  foreign key (user_id)
  references auth.users(id);
end;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.reset_database()
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
BEGIN
  -- Delete all data from tables
  DELETE FROM daily_challenges;
  DELETE FROM user_progress;
  DELETE FROM training_questions;
  DELETE FROM training_modules;
  DELETE FROM account_entries;
  DELETE FROM flights;

-- Insert flight types if not exists
INSERT INTO flight_types (id, name, description, requires_instructor) VALUES

  ('navigation', 'Navigation', 'Vol de navigation', false),
  ('discovery', 'Vol Dcouverte', 'Vol dcouverte pour le public', true)
ON CONFLICT (id) DO NOTHING;

-- Insert test reservations for the next few days
WITH aircraft_ids AS (SELECT id FROM aircraft WHERE status = 'AVAILABLE'),
     pilot_ids AS (SELECT id FROM users WHERE role IN ('PILOT', 'INSTRUCTOR')),
     flight_type_ids AS (SELECT id FROM flight_types)
INSERT INTO reservations (
  id, 
  user_id, 
  aircraft_id, 
  flight_type_id,
  start_time, 
  end_time, 
  with_instructor,
  status
)
SELECT
  gen_random_uuid(),
  pilot_id,
  aircraft_id,
  flight_type_id,
  start_time,
  start_time + interval '2 hours',
  CASE WHEN ft.requires_instructor THEN true ELSE false END,
  'ACTIVE'
FROM (
  SELECT 
    p.pilot_id,
    a.aircraft_id,
    ft.id as flight_type_id,
    ft.requires_instructor,
    (CURRENT_DATE + (n || ' days')::interval)::timestamp + '10:00'::time AS start_time
  FROM 
    (SELECT id AS pilot_id FROM pilot_ids) p
    CROSS JOIN (SELECT id AS aircraft_id FROM aircraft_ids) a
    CROSS JOIN (SELECT id, requires_instructor FROM flight_types) ft
    CROSS JOIN generate_series(1, 5) n
  LIMIT 10
) AS reservations(pilot_id, aircraft_id, flight_type_id, requires_instructor, start_time)
JOIN flight_types ft ON ft.id = flight_type_id;

-- Insert test flights
WITH pilot_ids AS (SELECT id FROM users WHERE role IN ('PILOT', 'INSTRUCTOR')),
     aircraft_ids AS (SELECT id FROM aircraft WHERE status = 'AVAILABLE'),
     flight_type_ids AS (SELECT id FROM flight_types)
INSERT INTO flights (
  id, 
  user_id, 
  aircraft_id, 
  flight_type_id,
  date, 
  duration, 
  cost, 
  payment_method, 
  is_validated
)
SELECT
  gen_random_uuid(),
  pilot_id,
  aircraft_id,
  flight_type_id,
  flight_date,
  duration,
  cost,
  payment_method,
  is_validated
FROM (
  SELECT 
    pilot_id,
    aircraft_id,
    (SELECT id FROM flight_types ORDER BY random() LIMIT 1) as flight_type_id,
    CURRENT_DATE - (n || ' days')::interval AS flight_date,
    60 * (1 + random()::int) AS duration,
    150 * (1 + random()::int) AS cost,
    CASE (random() * 3)::int
      WHEN 0 THEN 'ACCOUNT'
      WHEN 1 THEN 'CARD'
      ELSE 'CASH'
    END AS payment_method,
    random() > 0.3 AS is_validated
  FROM 
    (SELECT id AS pilot_id FROM pilot_ids) p
    CROSS JOIN (SELECT id AS aircraft_id FROM aircraft_ids) a
    CROSS JOIN generate_series(1, 10) n
  LIMIT 20
) AS flights(pilot_id, aircraft_id, flight_type_id, flight_date, duration, cost, payment_method, is_validated);

-- Insert account entries for flights
INSERT INTO account_entries (id, user_id, date, type, amount, payment_method, description, is_validated)
SELECT
  gen_random_uuid(),
  user_id,
  date,
  'FLIGHT',
  -cost,
  payment_method,
  'Vol du ' || to_char(date, 'DD/MM/YYYY'),
  is_validated
FROM flights;
  -- Return success
  RETURN;
END;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.send_welcome_email(p_email text, p_user_metadata jsonb)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
begin
    -- Utilise l'API Supabase pour envoyer l'email
    select net.http_post(
        url := 'https://jqrijsrbeksztlgnciah.supabase.co/auth/v1/admin/send-email',
        headers := jsonb_build_object(
            'Content-Type', 'application/json',
            'Authorization', current_setting('request.header.apikey')
        ),
        body := jsonb_build_object(
            'email', p_email,
            'template', 'welcome',  -- Le nom de votre template
            'data', p_user_metadata
        )
    );
end;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_auth_user_id(user_email text, new_id text)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
declare
  old_id text;
begin
  -- Rcuprer l'ancien ID
  select id::text into old_id from auth.users where email = user_email;
  
  -- Mettre  jour l'ID dans auth.identities
  update auth.identities
  set user_id = new_id::uuid
  where user_id::text = old_id;
  
  -- Mettre  jour l'ID dans auth.sessions
  update auth.sessions
  set user_id = new_id::uuid
  where user_id::text = old_id;
  
  -- Mettre  jour l'ID dans auth.mfa_factors
  update auth.mfa_factors
  set user_id = new_id::uuid
  where user_id::text = old_id;
  
  -- Mettre  jour l'ID dans auth.refresh_tokens
  update auth.refresh_tokens
  set user_id = new_id::uuid
  where user_id::text = old_id;
  
  -- Finalement, mettre  jour l'ID dans auth.users
  update auth.users
  set id = new_id::uuid
  where email = user_email;
end;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_user_groups(p_user_id uuid, p_groups text[])
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
DECLARE
    group_name text;
    group_id uuid;
BEGIN
    -- Supprimer toutes les associations existantes pour cet utilisateur
    DELETE FROM public.user_group_memberships
    WHERE user_id = p_user_id;

    -- Pour chaque groupe fourni
    FOREACH group_name IN ARRAY p_groups
    LOOP
        -- Rcuprer l'ID du groupe
        SELECT id INTO group_id
        FROM public.user_groups
        WHERE name = group_name;

        -- Si le groupe existe
        IF group_id IS NOT NULL THEN
            -- Insrer la nouvelle association
            INSERT INTO public.user_group_memberships (user_id, group_id)
            VALUES (p_user_id, group_id);
        ELSE
            -- Crer le groupe s'il n'existe pas
            INSERT INTO public.user_groups (name, description)
            VALUES (group_name, 'Automatically created group')
            RETURNING id INTO group_id;

            -- Puis crer l'association
            INSERT INTO public.user_group_memberships (user_id, group_id)
            VALUES (p_user_id, group_id);
        END IF;
    END LOOP;
END;
$function$

functions.name: validate_flight_and_account
functions.definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.validate_flight_and_account(flight_id uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
BEGIN
  -- Update flight validation status
  UPDATE flights 
  SET is_validated = true,
      updated_at = NOW()
  WHERE id = flight_id;

  -- Update corresponding account entry
  UPDATE account_entries
  SET is_validated = true,
      updated_at = NOW()
  WHERE flight_id = flight_id;
END;
$function$
